data.title: Kyle Diangkinay - Social Media Manager - Staff Directory
data.meta_description:
Kyle Diangkinay was hired in July 2021 in the newly-created position of Social Media Manager within New York University's Department of Athletics.  

A 2017 graduate
data.text:
Choose a Staff Member:

Kyle Diangkinay

Title

Social Media Manager

Email

kyle.diangkinay@nyu.edu

Phone

212-998-2042

Kyle Diangkinay was hired in July 2021 in the newly-created position of Social Media Manager within New York University's Department of Athletics.

A 2017 graduate of Wheaton (MA) College with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Business & Management Analytics & New Media, Diangkinay joins the Violets bringing a vast array of collegiate and professional sports experience. When not at NYU, the New York City product also serves as the Content Lead for What Pros Wear (@whatproswear, whatproswear.com), a baseball gear media hub that focuses on the equipment professional players utilize on and off the field. Through frequent interaction with the game's most talented in the world, his work includes in-clubhouse and pre-game interviews as well as collaborations with brands as part of product activations.

In 2020, he started his own multimedia company, Kyle Diangkinay Multimedia, in August of 2020. The company utilizes the guiding principle of "telling stories through sport" by editing high-quality multimedia content to bolster the notion that sports are a metaphor for life.

Diangkinay, who also earned a Master's of Business in Leadership in 2019 from the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth, served as a Graduate Assistant for Athletic Communications. He wrote and edited press releases, game recaps and feature stories as part of maintaining the University's athletics website. Diangkinay also created and supplied content for their social media platforms.

Diangkinay also served as the Coordinator of National Team Operations for the Baseball World Classic (WBC) in 2020. Part of his duties included monitoring and facilitating the flow of information and progress of documentation between the Major League Baseball operations department, WBC organizers and the National Team.

A native and resident of Queens, NY, Diangkinay also has experience working for Nike in the role of Athlete & Community Ambassador (2016-20) and for the United States Tennis Association (2019-20) in Operations and Player Relations.
